title: How to publish Kindle books on Amazon as a 'real' publishing house (i.e. what are the alternatives to KDP) - Quora

response.answer_text: To publish in KDP as a Publisher and not just an individual, you need to get an EIN number.   By creating your KDP account with an EIN number, this makes you a publisher and gives you a publishing account...which is nice.   Whether you are in the US or outside, you can use this article to get your EIN: Avoid the 30% Tax Withholding for Non-US Self Publishers From then on, you have a couple of options on how much you want to make yourself a "Real" publishing house.   First off, I would recommend making your publishing company a Limited Liability Corporation (LLC).  This makes you a legitimate business, and will protect your assets.   If you aren't from the US, there are ways you can setup  one in the US.   If you want setup your own Publishing company, then I recommend you cehck this out: Ultimate Guide on How to Start a Publishing Company
